column4: People, please, help needed. Why does the 6.10 Alternate CD not let me resize 80 GB NTFS Partition so I can use 20 GB for Linux?
try the burning the gparted livecd
I have the Gparted live CD.
But I'll also need to create a swap partition, correct?
usually you do. if that is a problem you can create a swap file
Then how much space should I give for swap file?
for a newer system? i get away with 256 and rarely touch it
if you have the space just make it same as ram
So in Gparted, I shrink NTFS to like 57 or 58 GB, then make ext3 partition for 20 GB, then Swap for 1 GB?
sounds good 1gb is more than enough
Okay, cool. So should I go for ext2, or ext3?
i would go with journaling ext3.
Gotcha. So from 80 GB NTFS, go to 59 GB NTFS, then 1 GB Swap, then 1 GB ext3. Right?
20GB ext3 for / would be simplest then 1GB for swap. alot of people like to make /home seperate too just for reinstalls and stuff but thats up to you
Alright, then after partitioning with Gparted livecd, do I use 6.10 alternate CD, and it will let me install to this new ext3 partition?
yeah you basically just select the partition and then tell it the mount point which would be / and then type ext3  and then type swap for swap
